alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Magoffin; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Morgan, southwestern Johnson and Magoffin Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 417 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Haleburg, or 8 miles north of Salyersville, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Orient and Grayfox around 420 PM EDT. Plutarch, Ever, Cisco, Quod, Lacey, Bloomington, Minefork and Win around 425 PM EDT. Tella, Coon, Flat Fork, Wonnie, Hargis and Harper around 430 PM EDT. Licksburg, Leatha, Wheelersburg, Elsie, Patton, Niles and Bethanna around 435 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Perlie, Cyrus, Brownlow, Gifford, Kernie, Oil Springs, Hager, Salyersville, Stringtown, Falcon, Gullett, Stella, Ova, Mashfork, Ballot, Mason, Burning Fork, Lakesville, Conley and Fritz. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
